description:
A walk to explore Raymond Unwin's aspirations to create a new form of town extension which encompassed the best aspects of town and country. Run by David Davidson of the Hampstead Garden Suburb Trust. 

2 of 3 tours run by the Trust.

factsheet.heading: The Sharing of Great Things
paragraphs: A walking tour exploring the older part of Hampstead Garden Suburb,  which is a planned community founded in 1907 by the social reformer Henrietta Barnett. The community was built in a largely Arts & Crafts style with a great emphasis on the townscape as a whole rather than individual buildings.

location.address: The Old Bull and Bush, North End Way, NW3 7HE
travel_info: Additional travel info: Start outside the Old Bull and Bush (nearest station Golders Green tube); end at Temple Fortune House (Finchley Road).

name: The Sharing of Great Things
